oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Integration of biological mite control into outdoor strawberry production: a matter of efficacy and economy
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tuovinen, Tuomo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ten years experiences in experimental and practical fields prove that effective control of strawberry mite can be achieved by inundative introductions of the predatory mite Amblyseius cucumeris. Lately, Neoseiulus barkeri has been included to experiments compare its efficacy especially in higher strawberry mite densities.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Tuovinen, Tuomo (2006) Integration of biological mite control into outdoor strawberry production: a matter of efficacy and economy. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 2 (10), p. 13.
